AddReactive<T>(ICollection<T>, T)

Add an element with a destroy handler to the collection and remove it from the list when it is destroyed.

Declaration
public static void AddReactive<T>(this ICollection<T> coll, T val)
    where T : class, IHasDestroyHandler<IModel>
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<T> coll

The collection to add and remove the element from.
T val

The element to add and remove reactively.
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type of the object you are adding to the collection.

Connect<TTarget>(IReadOnlyReactiveCollection<TTarget>, Action<CollectionAddEvent<TTarget>>, Action<CollectionRemoveEvent<TTarget>>)

Connect this collection to another so that it reacts to additions and removals from the connected collection.

Declaration
public static void Connect<TTarget>(this IReadOnlyReactiveCollection<TTarget> self, Action<CollectionAddEvent<TTarget>> add, Action<CollectionRemoveEvent<TTarget>> remove)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UniRx.IReadOnlyReactiveCollection<TTarget> self

The collection to connect to and watch.
System.Action<UniRx.CollectionAddEvent<TTarget>> add

Called when an element is added to the connected collection.
System.Action<UniRx.CollectionRemoveEvent<TTarget>> remove

Called when an element is removed from the connected collection.
Type Parameters
Name Description
TTarget

The type of the connected collection.
